args:
Does this describe a specific, new, official action or formal announcement already taken/made by the Trump administration? Answer only "yes" or "no".
Labor Department blocked from sharing data with DOGE, email says
The U.S. Labor Department has been temporarily blocked by court order from sharing data with Elon Musk’s U.S. DOGE Service, according to an email from a union that represents federal government workers. The email was obtained by The Washington Post.
The temporary order arrives after DOGE representatives visited the Labor Department this week, seeking sensitive data that the agency keeps. In response, a group of powerful unions swiftly sued DOGE in U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia on Wednesday, arguing that DOGE’s work was illegal and has “already been catastrophic.”
“Thanks to our swift response and the support of our labor partners, we successfully obtained a temporary order preventing DOL from sharing any data with DOGE,” said an email sent Thursday to rank-and-file Labor Department staffers by AFGE Local 12, a union representing federal government employees.
On Wednesday, a protest led by major unions including the AFL-CIO drew hundreds of people outside the agency’s headquarters in Washington.
The Labor Department manages huge volumes of sensitive data related to the labor market, unemployment claims, disability insurance, workplace health and safety, whistleblower reports and wage theft.
“This order remains in effect until the court rules on the temporary restraining order,” the union email said. “The DOGE will continue to visit but should not be accessing anything.”
